definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: No one wanted detainees ” the special-operations officer told me.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人想要的是囚犯，”這個特戰官員告訴我。

sentences.english: Many prisoners were tortured and were victims of gruesome medical experiments.
sentences.chinese: 許多囚犯慘遭蹂躪，成爲了可怕的醫學實驗的受害者。

sentences.english: A prisoner was attempting to escape from a tower.
sentences.chinese: 一個囚犯企圖逃離關押他的塔。

sentences.english: More than five prisoners have escaped from this prison.
sentences.chinese: 已經有五個以上囚犯從這個監獄逃掉了。

sentences.english: According to the act of grace many prisoners will be set free.
sentences.chinese: 按照大赦令，很多囚犯獲得釋放。

sentences.english: He kicked at the bound prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他朝那被綁着的囚犯踢了一腳。

sentences.english: He advised the judge not to sentence the prisoner to death.
sentences.chinese: 他建議法官不要判處這個囚犯死刑。

sentences.english: On Sabertron, the Destrons incite an uprising among the prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 塞伯特恩之迪斯坦逆黨煽動囚犯暴動。

sentences.english: At once all the prison doors flew open, and everybody's chains came loose.
sentences.chinese: 監門立刻全開，衆囚犯的鎖鏈也都鬆開了。

sentences.english: The guards often yelled at him and the other prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 警衛對他和其他囚犯厲聲呵斥。

sentences.english: A pair of guards dragged a prisoner in through the tower's stone doorway.
sentences.chinese: 兩個守衛把一個囚犯拖進來，穿過塔樓的石梯入口。

sentences.english: With a period of only thee weeks, five prisoners succeeded in escaping from the prison.
sentences.chinese: 那囚犯費盡心機找一個越獄的辦法，他終於成功了。

sentences.english: The prisoners were left to rot in prison.
sentences.chinese: 那些囚犯被留置在牢中任其消瘦。

sentences.english: The door opened and the prisoners dashed out.
sentences.chinese: 牢門開了，囚犯們衝了出去。
韋爾奇男士從前是囚犯。

definition: prisoner that awaits execution/convict sentenced to death/someone on death row
